list_nested.description:
- for GBP-based policy, all src_tags and dst_tags have to be gbp-based
- for ACL-based policy, `network` is required in either the source or destination so that we know where to attach the policy to

list.description:
- for GBP-based policy, all src_tags and dst_tags have to be gbp-based
- for ACL-based policy, `network` is required in either the source or destination so that we know where to attach the policy to

int64.description:
required if
- `type`==`dynamic_gbp` (gbp_tag received from RADIUS)
- `type`==`gbp_resource`
- `type`==`static_gbp` (applying gbp tag against matching conditions)

list.description:
required if 
- `type`==`mac`
- `type`==`static_gbp` if from matching mac

string.description:
if:
  * `type`==`mac` (optional. default is `any`)
  * `type`==`subnet` (optional. default is `any`)
  * `type`==`network`
  * `type`==`resource` (optional. default is `any`)
  * `type`==`static_gbp` if from matching network (vlan)'

required if:
  * `type`==`radius_group`
  * `type`==`static_gbp`
if from matching radius_group

list_nested.description:
if `type`==`resource` or `type`==`gbp_resource`
empty means unrestricted, i.e. any

list.description:
if 
- `type`==`subnet` 
- `type`==`resource` (optional. default is `any`)
- `type`==`static_gbp` if from matching subnet

string.description:
enum: 
  * `any`: matching anything not identified
  * `dynamic_gbp`: from the gbp_tag received from RADIUS
  * `gbp_resource`: can only be used in `dst_tags`
  * `mac`
  * `network`
  * `radius_group`
  * `resource`: can only be used in `dst_tags`
  * `static_gbp`: applying gbp tag against matching conditions
  * `subnet`'

map_nested.description: ACL Tags to identify traffic source or destination. Key name is the tag name

list.description:
additional CLI commands to append to the generated Junos config

**Note**: no check is done

bool.description: Enable for dynamic ARP inspection check
Enable for check for forging source IP address

list.description: if `all_networks`==`false`, list of network with DHCP snooping enabled
Global dns settings. To keep compatibility, dns settings in `ip_config` and `oob_ip_config` will overwrite this setting

custom.schema_definition:
listvalidator.ValueStringsAre(
  stringvalidator.Any(
    mistvalidator.ParseIp(true, false), 
    mistvalidator.ParseVar(),
  ),
),
listvalidator.SizeAtLeast(1)

list.description: Global dns settings. To keep compatibility, dns settings in `ip_config` and `oob_ip_config` will overwrite this setting

bool.description: this takes precedence
this takes precedence

map_nested.description: Property key is the destination CIDR (e.g. "2a02:1234:420a:10c9::/64")

string.description: Unique ID of the object instance in the Mist Organnization
only required for EVPN-VXLAN networks, IPv4 Virtual Gateway
only required for EVPN-VXLAN networks, IPv6 Virtual Gateway

bool.description:
whether to stop clients to talk to each other, default is false (when enabled, a unique isolation_vlan_id is required)
NOTE: this features requires uplink device to also a be Juniper device and `inter_switch_link` to be set

string.description: optional for pure switching, required when L3 / routing features are used
optional for pure switching, required when L3 / routing features are used

map_nested.description: Property key is network name

list.description: list of NTP servers specific to this device. By default, those in Site Settings will be used

map.description: Required if `auth_type`==`md5`. Property key is the key number

string.description: Required if `auth_type`==`password`, the password, max length is 8

bool.description: by default, we'll re-advertise all learned OSPF routes toward overlay
whether to send OSPF-Hello

map_nested.description: Junos OSPF areas

list.description: at least one of the `input_port_ids_ingress`, `input_port_ids_egress` or `input_networks_ingress ` should be specified
at least one of the `input_port_ids_ingress`, `input_port_ids_egress` or `input_networks_ingress ` should be specified
at least one of the `input_port_ids_ingress`, `input_port_ids_egress` or `input_networks_ingress ` should be specified

string.description: exaclty one of the `output_port_id` or `output_network` should be provided
exaclty one of the `output_port_id` or `output_network` should be provided

map_nested.description:
Property key is the port mirroring instance name
port_mirroring can be added under device/site settings. It takes interface and ports as input for ingress, interface as input for egress and can take interface and port as output. A maximum 4 port mirrorings is allowed

bool.description: Only if `mode`==`trunk` whether to trunk all network/vlans

Only if `mode`!=`dynamic`. If DHCP snooping is enabled, whether DHCP server is allowed on the interfaces with.
All the interfaces from port configs using this port usage are effected. Please notice that allow_dhcpd is a tri_state.
When it is not defined, it means using the system's default setting which depends on whether the port is a access or trunk port.
Only if `mode`!=`dynamic`
Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` and `port_auth`==`dot1x` bypass auth for known clients if set to true when RADIUS server is down
Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` and `port_auth`=`dot1x` bypass auth for all (including unknown clients) if set to true when RADIUS server is down
Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` if speed and duplex are specified, whether to disable autonegotiation
Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` whether the port is disabled

string.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` link connection mode. enum: `auto`, `full`, `half`

list.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` and `port_auth`==`dot1x`, if dynamic vlan is used, specify the possible networks/vlans RADIUS can return

bool.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` and `port_auth`==`dot1x` whether to enable MAC Auth
Only if `mode`!=`dynamic`

string.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` and `port_auth`==`dot1x` which network to put the device into if the device cannot do dot1x. default is null (i.e. not allowed)

bool.description:
Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` inter_switch_link is used together with "isolation" under networks
NOTE: inter_switch_link works only between Juniper device. This has to be applied to both ports connected together
Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` and `enable_mac_auth`==`true`
Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` + `enable_mac_auth`==`true` + `mac_auth_only`==`false`, dot1x will be given priority then mac_auth. Enable this to prefer mac_auth over dot1x.

string.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` and `enable_mac_auth` ==`true`. This type is ignored if mist_nac is enabled. enum: `eap-md5`, `eap-peap`, `pap`

int64.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` max number of mac addresses, default is 0 for unlimited, otherwise range is 1 or higher, with upper bound constrained by platform

string.description: `mode`==`dynamic` must only be used if the port usage name is `dynamic`. enum: `access`, `dynamic`, `inet`, `trunk`

int64.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` media maximum transmission unit (MTU) is the largest data unit that can be forwarded without fragmentation. The default value is 1514.

list.description: Only if `mode`==`trunk`, the list of network/vlans

bool.description: Only if `mode`==`access` and `port_auth`!=`dot1x` whether the port should retain dynamically learned MAC addresses
Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` whether PoE capabilities are disabled for a port

string.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` if dot1x is desired, set to dot1x. enum: `dot1x`
Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` native network/vlan for untagged traffic

int64.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` and `port_auth`=`dot1x` reauthentication interval range

string.description: Only if `mode`==`dynamic` Control when the DPC port should be changed to the default port usage. enum: `link_down`, `none` (let the DPC port keep at the current port usage)

list.description: use `equals_any` to match any item in a list

string.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` and `port_auth`==`dot1x` sets server fail fallback vlan
Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` and `port_auth`==`dot1x` when radius server reject / fails
Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` speed, default is auto to automatically negotiate speed enum: `100m`, `10m`, `1g`, `2.5g`, `5g`, `10g`, `25g`, `40g`, `100g`,`auto`

bool.description: whether to disable storm control on broadcast traffic
whether to disable storm control on multicast traffic
whether to disable storm control on registered multicast traffic
whether to disable storm control on unknown unicast traffic

int64.description: bandwidth-percentage, configures the storm control level as a percentage of the available bandwidth

bool.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` when enabled, the port is not expected to receive BPDU frames

string.description: optional for Campus Fabric Core-Distribution ESI-LAG profile. Helper used by the UI to select this port profile as the ESI-Lag between Distribution and Access switches

bool.description: if this is connected to a vstp network

string.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` network/vlan for voip traffic, must also set port_network. to authenticate device, set port_auth

map_nested.description: Property key is the port usage name. Defines the profiles of port configuration configured on the switch

int64.description: how frequently should interim accounting be reported, 60-65535. default is 0 (use one specified in Access-Accept request from RADIUS Server). Very frequent messages can affect the performance of the radius server, 600 and up is recommended when enabled
Acct port of RADIUS server
Auth port of RADIUS server

bool.description: whether to require Message-Authenticator in requests

int64.description: radius auth session retries
radius auth session timeout

string.description:
use `network`or `source_ip`
which network the RADIUS server resides, if there's static IP for this network, we'd use it as source-ip
if source_address is configured, will use the vlan firstly otherwise use source_ip
if source_address is configured, will use the vlan firstly otherwise use source_ip

bool.description: by default, when we configure a device, we only clean up config we generates. Remove existing configs if enabled

string.description: client_list_name here should refer to client_list above
view name here should be defined in views above
<refer to notify tag, can be multiple with blank
refer to notify target parameters name

Not required if `authentication_type`==`authentication_none`
include alphabetic, numeric, and special characters, but it cannot include control characters.

sha224, sha256, sha384, sha512 are supported in 21.1 and newer release. enum: `authentication_md5`, `authentication_none`, `authentication_sha`, `authentication_sha224`, `authentication_sha256`, `authentication_sha384`, `authentication_sha512`

Not required if `encryption_type`==`privacy-none`
include alphabetic, numeric, and special characters, but it cannot include control characters

bool.description: if the root oid configured is included

list.description:
additional CLI commands to append to the generated Junos config

**Note**: no check is done

string.description: VLAN Name for the management interface
'property key define the type of matching, value is the string to match. e.g: `match_name[0:3]`, `match_name[2:6]`, `match_model`,  `match_model[0-6]`

bool.description: f supported on the platform. If enabled, DNS will be using this routing-instance, too
for host-out traffic (NTP/TACPLUS/RADIUS/SYSLOG/SNMP), if alternative source network/ip is desired
To disable LACP support for the AE interface

int64.description: Users could force to use the designated AE name

bool.description: to use fast timeout
if want to generate port up/down alarm
if `speed` and `duplex` are specified, whether to disable autonegotiation

string.description: Enable dynamic usage for this port. Set to `dynamic` to enable.

int64.description: media maximum transmission unit (MTU) is the largest data unit that can be forwarded without fragmentation

bool.description: prevent helpdesk to override the port config

string.description: port usage name. If EVPN is used, use `evpn_uplink`or `evpn_downlink`

map_nested.description: Propery key is the interface name or interface range

list.description: at least one of the `input_port_ids_ingress`, `input_port_ids_egress` or `input_networks_ingress ` should be specified
at least one of the `input_port_ids_ingress`, `input_port_ids_egress` or `input_networks_ingress ` should be specified
at least one of the `input_port_ids_ingress`, `input_port_ids_egress` or `input_networks_ingress ` should be specified

map_nested.description:
Property key is the port mirroring instance name
port_mirroring can be added under device/site settings. It takes interface and ports as input for ingress, interface as input for egress and can take interface and port as output. A maximum 4 port mirrorings is allowed

int64.description: ap_affinity_threshold ap_affinity_threshold can be added as a field under site/setting. By default this value is set to 12. If the field is set in both site/setting and org/setting, the value from site/setting will be used.

string.description: Set Banners for switches. Allows markup formatting

int64.description: Sets timeout for switches
the rollback timer for commit confirmed

bool.description: Enable to provide the FQDN with DHCP option 81

map_nested.description: Property key is the user name. For Local user authentication

list.description: optionally, services we'll allow. enum: `icmp`, `ssh`

string.description: matched dst port, "0" means any. Note: For `protocol`==`any` and  `port_range`==`any`, configure `trusted_hosts` instead
enum: `any`, `icmp`, `tcp`, `udp`. Note: For `protocol`==`any` and  `port_range`==`any`, configure `trusted_hosts` instead

custom.schema_definition:
listvalidator.SizeAtLeast(1),
listvalidator.ValueStringsAre(
  stringvalidator.Any(
  mistvalidator.ParseCidr(true, true),
  mistvalidator.ParseIp(true, true),
  ),
)

bool.description:
when enabled, all traffic that is not essential to our operation will be dropped
e.g. ntp / dns / traffic to mist will be allowed by default
     if dhcpd is enabled, we'll make sure it works

list.description: host/subnets we'll allow traffic to/from

single_nested.description:
restrict inbound-traffic to host
when enabled, all traffic that is not essential to our operation will be dropped 
e.g. ntp / dns / traffic to mist will be allowed by default, if dhcpd is enabled, we'll make sure it works

port_mirroring can be added under device/site settings. It takes interface and ports as input for ingress, interface as input for egress and can take interface and port as output. A maximum 4 port mirrorings is allowed

int64.description: ap_affinity_threshold ap_affinity_threshold can be added as a field under site/setting. By default this value is set to 12. If the field is set in both site/setting and org/setting, the value from site/setting will be used.

string.description: Set Banners for switches. Allows markup formatting

int64.description: Sets timeout for switches
the rollback timer for commit confirmed

bool.description: Enable to provide the FQDN with DHCP option 81

map_nested.description: Property key is the user name. For Local user authentication

list.description: optionally, services we'll allow. enum: `icmp`, `ssh`

string.description: matched dst port, "0" means any. Note: For `protocol`==`any` and  `port_range`==`any`, configure `trusted_hosts` instead
enum: `any`, `icmp`, `tcp`, `udp`. Note: For `protocol`==`any` and  `port_range`==`any`, configure `trusted_hosts` instead

custom.schema_definition:
listvalidator.SizeAtLeast(1),
listvalidator.ValueStringsAre(
  stringvalidator.Any(
  mistvalidator.ParseCidr(true, true),
  mistvalidator.ParseIp(true, true),
  ),
)

bool.description:
when enabled, all traffic that is not essential to our operation will be dropped
e.g. ntp / dns / traffic to mist will be allowed by default
     if dhcpd is enabled, we'll make sure it works

list.description: host/subnets we'll allow traffic to/from

single_nested.description:
restrict inbound-traffic to host
when enabled, all traffic that is not essential to our operation will be dropped 
e.g. ntp / dns / traffic to mist will be allowed by default, if dhcpd is enabled, we'll make sure it works

string.description: which network the TACACS server resides

bool.description: to use mxedge as proxy
Whether to do 802.1x against uplink switch. When enaled, AP cert will be used to do EAP-TLS and the Org's CA Cert has to be provisioned at the switch
by default, WLANs are disabled when uplink is down. In some scenario, like SiteSurvey, one would want the AP to keep sending beacons.
whether to enable VRF (when supported on the device)

map_nested.description: Property key is the destination CIDR (e.g. "10.0.0.0/8")
Property key is the network name
